title: Fit PSD model
text: consider first chromosome data 1000 Genomes Project (TGP) use PSD model fit data.

what: Fit PSD model by EM algorithm
title: Fit PSD model
text: fit PSD model EM algorithm, use loss function stopping criterion. EM algorithm converges slowly. takes 450 EM iterations reach predetermined accuracy. import pre-trained results directly. plot loss function number iterations using package ggplot2, loss function records 10 iterations.  plot ancestral proportions individuals using package ggplot2. fitting result EM algorithm accurate.
code: result_TGP_em <- psd_fit_em(data_TGP, 3, 1e-5, 500) data(result_TGP_em) L <- result_TGP_em$Loss plot_loss(L[-1], 10, "em") P <- result_TGP_em$P pops <- order(colMeans(P)) plot_structure(P, pops)

what: Fit PSD model by SQP algorithm
title: Fit PSD model
text: fit PSD model SQP algorithm, use loss function stopping criterion. Although SQP algorithm converges fast, easy converge local optimal value. prevent bad scenario, start 100 EM iterations, need 30 SQP iterations reach accuracy requirement. import pre-trained results directly. plot loss function number iterations using package ggplot2, loss function records 10 iterations.  plot ancestral proportions individuals using package ggplot2. Notice fitting result SQP algorithm excellent.
code: result_TGP_sqp <- psd_fit_sqp(data_TGP, 3, 1e-5, 50, 100) data(result_TGP_sqp) L <- result_TGP_sqp$Loss plot_loss(L[-1], 10, "em & sqp") P <- result_TGP_sqp$P pops <- order(colMeans(P)) plot_structure(P, pops)

what: Fit PSD model by VI algorithm
title: Fit PSD model
text: fit PSD model VI algorithm, use loss function stopping criterion. Similar EM algorithm, convergence VI algorithm also relatively slow, 440 iterations needed reach accuracy requirement. import pre-trained results directly. plot loss function number iterations using package ggplot2, loss function records 10 iterations.  plot ancestral proportions individuals using package ggplot2. fitting result much better EM algorithm.
code: result_TGP_vi <- psd_fit_vi(data_TGP, 3, 1e-5, 500) data(result_TGP_vi) L <- result_TGP_vi$Loss plot_loss(L[-1], 10, "vi") P <- result_TGP_vi$P pops <- order(colMeans(P)) plot_structure(P, pops)

what: Fit PSD model by SVI algorithm
title: Fit PSD model
text: fit PSD model SVI algorithm, use loss function stopping criterion. completed fitting 42min, much longer previous three algorithms. Although SVI algorithm known fast speed, dataset large number individuals (). can predicted complete TGP data, SVI algorithm still needs time, time algorithms greatly increased. Perhaps time algorithms similar data similar TGP data size, number individuals () large, performance SVI algorithm much better, also superiority SVI algorithm. import pre-trained results directly. plot loss function number iterations using package ggplot2, loss function records 10,000 iterations. natural thing use change loss function stopping criterion, can seen , loss function validation set necessarily monotonic. sampling interval large, loss function oscillate near optimal value, cycle finished. sampling interval small, loss function almost constant, resulting premature exit loop. However, proper sampling intervals difficult find. simply added maximum number iterations (case, 50,000) stopping criterion, loss function used post-hoc metric.  plot ancestral proportions individuals using package ggplot2. convergence accuracy SVI algorithm also good.
code: result_TGP_svi <- psd_fit_svi(data_TGP, 3,                               1e-5, 5e+5, 100,                               5e-2, 1e-1, 1e+4,                               1, 0.5) data(result_TGP_svi) L <- result_TGP_svi$Loss plot_loss(L[-1], 1e+4, "svi") P <- result_TGP_svi$P pops <- order(colMeans(P)) plot_structure(P, pops)

code: @Manual{,   title = {AwesomePackage: Infer ancestry with some models and fit those models with some algorithms},   author = {Jonathon Chow},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/JONATHONCHOW/AwesomePackage, https://jonathonchow.github.io/AwesomePackage/}, }

what: Infer ancestry with some models and fit those models with some algorithms
title: Infer ancestry with some models and fit those models with some algorithms
text: goal AwesomePackage infer ancestry models fit models algorithms. use classical PSD model ancestor inference, widely used, STRUCTURE (Pritchard et al. 2000, MCMC), FRAPPE (Tang et al. 2005, EM), ADMIXTURE (Alexander et al. 2009, SQP), fastSTRUCTURE (Raj et al. 2014, VI), TeraStructure (Gopalan et al. 2017, SVI). illustrate close relationship PSD model, Poisson NMF model, multinomial topic model LDA model, can optimize algorithm. use Expectation-Maximization algorithm (EM), sequential quadratic programming algorithm (SQP), variational inference algorithm (VI) stochastic variational inference algorithm (SVI) fit model, illustrate relationships differences algorithms simulation experiments real data experiments.

text: 1000 Genomes Project (TGP) created catalogue common human genetic variation, using openly consented samples people declared healthy. reference data resources generated project remain heavily used biomedical science community. International Genome Sample Resource (IGSR) maintains shares human genetic variation resources built 1000 Genomes Project. also update resources current reference assembly, add new data sets generated 1000 Genomes Project samples add data projects working openly consented samples.

Plot the loss function — plot_loss
text: Plot loss function number iterations using package ggplot2.

title: Plot the loss function — plot_loss
code: plot_loss(   L,   sample.rate,   method,   epsilon = 0.01,   colors = c("#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73", "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7"),   linetypes = "solid",   linesizes = 0.5,   shapes = 19,   fills = "white",   theme = function() theme_cowplot(12) )

title: Plot the loss function — plot_loss
text: L vector represents loss function. sample.rate sampling rate loss function. method name fitting algorithm, "em", "sqp", "vi", "svi". epsilon small, positive number added vertical axis logarithmic scale -emphasize small differences. colors colors used draw loss curves. linetypes line types used draw loss curves. linesizes line sizes used draw loss curves. shapes shapes used draw points selected iterations. fills fill colors used draw points selected iterations. theme ggplot2 theme.

title: Plot the loss function — plot_loss
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot the loss function — plot_loss
Plot the population proportion — plot_structure
text: Plot population proportion individuals using package ggplot2.

title: Plot the population proportion — plot_structure
code: plot_structure(   P,   pops,   colors = c("#e41a1c", "#377eb8", "#4daf4a", "#984ea3", "#ff7f00", "#ffff33", "#a65628",     "#f781bf", "#999999"),   ticks = NULL,   font.size = 9 )

title: Plot the population proportion — plot_structure
text: P proportion matrix. pops Population order options. colors Theme color options. ticks Grouping options. font.size Font size used plot.

title: Plot the population proportion — plot_structure
text: ggplot object.

title: Plot the population proportion — plot_structure
code: P <- matrix(c(0.5,0.3,0.8, 0.5,0.7,0.2), 3, 2) pops <- order(colMeans(P)) plot_structure(P, pops)

what: Use EM algorithm to fit PSD model — psd_fit_em

text: Fit PSD model EM algorithm, use loss function stopping criterion.

title: Use EM algorithm to fit PSD model — psd_fit_em
Use EM algorithm to fit PSD model — psd_fit_em
text: G x J matrix counts; entries G taken {0,1,2}. K integer 2 greater giving matrix rank. epsilon Convergence criterion. maxiter maximum number iterations.

title: Use EM algorithm to fit PSD model — psd_fit_em
text: List following parameters: P population scale matrix individuals. F gene scale matrix populations. Loss vector represents value loss function records 10 iterations. Iterations integer represents number iterations.

title: Use SVI algorithm to fit PSD model — psd_fit_svi
text: G x J matrix counts; entries G taken {0,1,2}. K integer 2 greater giving matrix rank. epsilon Convergence criterion. maxiter maximum number iterations. subiter number iterations sampling section. val_J Sample proportion SNPs validation set. val_I Sample proportion individuals validation set. val_iter number iterations validation set sampling. tau parameter descending direction SVI algorithm. kappa parameter descending direction SVI algorithm.
